question:
A small bird native to Australian forests, the wattlebird honeyeater, is on the verge of extinction. The situation is made more difficult by the fact that these birds have trouble forming pairs. To help them, ornithologists capture the males and keep them in cages for a certain period of time. During this time, scientists effectively become "X" for the birds.
Question: Name X in two words.

In one humorous social ad, visitors come to the doctor at night. The father asks whether unvaccinated children are dangerous for his son. The point is that the visitors are X s. Name X s with a non-georgian word.
In the miniature of Kyrie Gray, this woman shoots a video in the so-called "unboxing" genre, and it is followed by a stream of negative comments. Guess the name of this woman.

After a trip to the south of France, a Soviet tourist, while describing the visitors of the X, mentions laboratory workers who were waiting in amazement for the results of the experiment. Name the X with a word of Italian origin.

A 1960s article that was published in the "Chicago Tribune", it is recommended to do this in the morning so as not to scare passersby and not to arouse the suspicion of the police. What do we changed by "do this"?
At the opening ceremony of the 2018 Olympics, dancers depicted the X, which many took to be part of a Pepsi advertising campaign. Describe the X in several (max 5) words.
In a modern film, a wealthy character looks at a filled cup of coffee to evaluate a hired worker. Name the profession of this worker.

In 1967, a well-known company purchased a large plot of land in the state of Florida, where, along with other buildings, the X was later built. You can see the X in the logo of this company. Name the X with two words that start with the same two letters.
One humorous poster depicts an electric duck, for single use. What word did we leave out in the previous sentence?

Speaking about the superstition associated with the X, Dick Swab cites the following story: Terry Cottle was shot in the forehead, and some time later, the overjoyed Sonny Graham married his (Terry's) widow. A few years later, Sonny also committed suicide. The first X dates back to 1967. Name the X with two words

In 2016, American Quincy Green was sentenced to house arrest. Despite this, he managed to commit a murder far from home because the police did not take into account that he had an X. Name the X in two words.

Martin McDonagh's gambling hero takes a pistol, shoots, puts down the pistol, takes a cigarette case, then takes a cigarette with his lips, puts down the cigarette case, takes a lighter, lights the cigarette, puts down the lighter, takes the phone. Restore the word that we replaced with the word "gambling".

In the animated series Aladdin's Adventures, one kingdom is distinguished by its cheese, which has a specific smell. The ruler of this kingdom was once nicknamed X. X is a famous novel, and at the beginning of one of its film adaptations, the humming of a plane is heard. Name X

A girl character in an American horror story dies after being abandoned by a rock musician. The relatives of the deceased, seeking revenge, send the singer a seemingly romantic gift — an X, which contains a ghost. Name the author of the X dated 1993.
A blogger writes that shepherds used this for another function as well; specifically, to avoid a lightning strike, they placed it in a bonfire. Name this with one word.

Recently, due to the casting of a black actress in the role of Hermione Granger, J.K. Rowling stated that the character's skin color is not specified in the books. However, in one episode, after an injury received from the Weasley brothers' toy telescope, Hermione is compared to an animal. Name this animal.

(Attention, fourth question) An American sergeant recalled that during World War II, amidst an artillery bombardment, he suddenly burst out laughing and tears of happiness came to his eyes because he remembered this. Write this down as precisely as possible.

A character from a novel who had returned from India was found suffocated in his bedroom, but in such a way that no human could have entered the victim's room. The detective realizes who or what the culprit is and asks his partner if he has read this work. Name this work!
answer: The Murders in the Rue Morgue

question: A character in an English-language TV series wants to break up with his girlfriend, so he uses a long business trip to an Arab country as an excuse. The character's uneducated friend agrees with his buddy and says that it really does sound like the name of a country. Write the name of this Arab country!
In a fantasy novel, an alien returns to the spaceship and starts changing shoes, which causes the humans present to smile. Question: Which Earth creature does this character resemble?

They say that in the 19th century sperm whales displayed rare intelligence and learned how to escape from hunters, which led to a sharp decline in the whaling industry. When they saw a ship, the whales would start swimming. Which three words were omitted from the previous sentence?

Some art historians see an imitation of a biblical scene in David’s The Death of Marat. Accordingly, they associate the wound inflicted by Charlotte Corday with another wound. Write the name of the person who inflicted that wound.
Because of X, the basketball players of the basketball circus “Harlem Globetrotters” had to perform two shows in one day. Name X using one word of Latin origin.

Because of so many concerts and constant touring, Robert Smith (the vocalist of the rock band The Cure) told the band’s manager that X had developed. We are not asking you to name X. Name a rock band whose name begins with the same four letters as X.

In a modern interpretation, X is presented as a nine-story building, on one floor of which a husband regularly beats his wife, and on another floor the family indifferently votes for a bloody dictator. Name X in one word.
